intro: Ixonanthes icosandra var. cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ixonanthes, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and ecological research.
